tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE robotic_system_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  system_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  data_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  speed FLOAT,
  efficiency FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE robotic_systems (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    start_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    end_time TIMESTAMP,
    status VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE performance_data (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT REFERENCES robotic_systems(id),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
   cpu_usage FLOAT,
    memory_usage FLOAT,
    temperature FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE PerformanceMetrics (
    metric_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robotic_system_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    error_code VARCHAR(10),
    performance_score FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE Workstation (
    workstation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    workstation_name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(100),
    robot_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES Robot(robot_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ProductionLog (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    workstation_id INT,
    start_time DATETIME,
    end_time DATETIME,
    performance_score DECIMAL(5, 2),
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES Robot(robot_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (workstation_id) REFERENCES Workstation(workstation_id)
);

CREATE TABLE MaintenanceLog (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    maintenance_date DATE,
    issue_description TEXT,
    resolution TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES Robot(robot_id)
);

CREATE TABLE SensorData (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    timestamp DATETIME,
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    value DECIMAL(10, 2),
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES Robot(robot_id)
);
